result.execSummary:
The defendant LaDonaven R Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Probation may be transferred to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation. DNA surcharge is WAIVED.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Court finds that if the Defendant successfully completes probation and has no new criminal law violations, Court will find that it is in the Defendant's interest to have this expunged and society will not be harmed and grant expunction.

Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed. Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Get High School Diploma/GED.
Case 15CM356 was dismissed and read into: 15CM480.

timeConds.notes: To perform as a Condition of Probation, at a rate of $10.00 per hour to help offset the costs.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. LaDonaven R Brown

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC 12/28/15
  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant LaDonaven R Brown in court with attorney Kelsey Morin.  Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 4.  Court finds defendant guilty. Cts. 1, 2 and 3 dismissed and read-in.  

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 4:
- 30 days jail straight time STAYED for one (1) year Probation - Probation maybe transferred to Milwaukee County
- Court Costs of $243.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- DNA Surcharge waived. 
- Conditions of  Probation:  Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.  Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Complete high school diploma.  
- Defendant to perform 24 hours of community service at a rate of $10.00 per hour to offset the costs as a Condition of Probation.

Defense requests expunction. 
State would not object to expunction if Probation is successfully completed. 
Court finds that if the defendant successfully completes probation and has no new criminal law violations, Court will find that it is in the defendant's interest and society 
will not be harmed and grant expunction.
Hearing at 09-24-2015 09:30 am

Defendant LaDonaven R Brown in court with attorney Kelsey Morin.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense still needs to speak to ADA Osborne. Deferred prosecution agreement addressed. Defense advise the defendant has a new case in Milwaukee. Court will give another date in 3 weeks. Court will put 15CM356 back on the jury status/jury trial calendar. 15CM480 to trail along.  Hearing scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Plea hearing on August 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Kelsey Morin in court.   Defendant Ladonaven R Brown did not appear.   Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense states there is a deferred prosecution agreement on this matter and requests another date. Court will adjourn the trial date and schedule this matter for 08/25/2015 at 8:30 a.m..  Plea hearing scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on August 20, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant LaDonaven R Brown in court with attorney Kelsey Morin.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises they need a jury status/jury trial on 15CM356.  15CM480 to trail along. Court grants request.  Hearing scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on July 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant LaDonaven R Brown in court.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Attorney appears by authorization.  Parties still negotiationg.  Hearing scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ladonaven R Brown in court with attorney Kelsey Morin.  Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization. Defense received documents from her client and needs to discuss this matter with ADA Osborne. Court will give another date in 2 weeks. Defense to let the court know on the next date how they will proceed on this matter.  Hearing scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Hearing on June 17, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Attorney appears by authorization

Attorney Jorge Fragoso for attorney Kelsey Morin.   Defendant Ladonaven R Brown did not appear.   Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization. Defense requested additional records and requests another date. Court will give a date in 3 weeks. Defense to let the Court know on the next date if this matter will be set for a plea or trial.  Hearing scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Ladonaven R Brown in court with attorney Kelsey Morin.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is waiting for discovery on 15CM480. Defense is also waiting for video evidence. Defense requests a date in 60 days. Court grants request.  Hearing scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on March 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.   Defendant to have no contact with Norris School unless he is authorized by school. Defendnat must live in his mother's home.
